article.headline: Sacred Heart 72, St. Francis, Pa. 64
article.story: LORETTO, Pa. (AP) -- Jarrid Frye scored 22 points and Sacred Heart rallied in the closing minutes to hand St. Francis, Pa., its 10th straight loss Saturday night, 72-64. Sacred Heart (10-8, 6-1 Northeast Conference) jumped out to a 12-2 lead but saw St. Francis (4-15, 1-7) stay close the rest of the way. The Red Flash took a 56-53 edge on J.R. Enright's jump hook with 5:59 remaining. The Pioneers answered with a 9-1 run, taking the lead for good, 58-57, on an offensive rebound and putback by Brice Brooks with 4:19 to go. Joey Henley followed with a bucket, then Frye hit two free throws to push the margin to 62-57. Sacred Heart sealed the win on a layup by Henley and two free throws by Chauncy Hardy in the final 26 seconds. Hardy scored 16 points for the Pioneers, who have won three in a row. Chris Berry led St. Francis with 18 points, while Marquis Ford added 15. The longest losing streak in Red Flash history is 12 games, which occurred last season when the team finished 4-24.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
